definition: soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body

sentences.english: There is no your news each time, I would be frightened of don't already daze.
sentences.chinese: 每次没有了你的消息，我都会失魂落魄的茫然不已。

sentences.english: So many, fearful, took with them their sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这么多的人，失魂落魄，承受着悲哀。

sentences.english: Going there we gain a day, leaving we'll lose our mind.
sentences.chinese: 飞到那儿我们赚了一天，离开那儿我们失魂落魄。

sentences.english: I was always quite fascinated by natural phenomena and changes of the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我总是失魂于自然现象和天空云物的改变。

sentences.english: His wife left him last year, and he's been really frustrated since then.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子去年离开了他，从此他就失魂落魄。

sentences.english: After Joe broke up with his girl friend, he was out of it for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 自从乔和女友分手后，他失魂落魄了好几个礼拜。
你看起来有点失魂落魄的。

sentences.english: During he whole of this time, Scrooge had acted like a man out of his wits.
sentences.chinese: 在整个这段时间内，斯克鲁吉像是失魂落魄似的。

sentences.english: That day I was a wreck wondering how she would react to it.
sentences.chinese: 那一天我失魂落魄，不知道她会如何反映。

sentences.english: So, after the shooting, she sat—soulless and waiting.
sentences.chinese: 所以，她开枪之后，失魂地坐在那里等待。

sentences.english: Her mother's voice in the corridor roused her from an angry trance.
sentences.chinese: 她气得失魂落魄，是她妈妈在走廊里的声音唤醒了她。

sentences.english: They're moving, but listlessly and not purposefully.
sentences.chinese: 他们移动，但失魂落魄并豪无目的。

definition: to bewitch/to enchant/to cast a spell over sb
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
overwhelmed (with joy, sorrow etc)/to feel transported
three immortal souls and seven mortal forms in Daoism, contrasting the spiritual and carnal side of man
a kind of sleeping gas or smoke used by thieves to incapacitate victims
